data.title: Rental assistance for new immigrants in Israel reduced by almost half
data.meta_description: Everything about Israel and Judaism in Spanish, current events in the Middle East, politics, history, tourism, sports, science and technology is here, at aurora-israel.co.il
data.meta_site_name: Aurora Israel: Últimas noticias Israel, Vida judía, Innovación Tecnológica Israelí y Avances Médicos israelis.
data.text:
On Tuesday, local Israeli media claimed that, within the framework of a widespread budget cut, the Ministry of Immigration and Absorption drastically reduced the financial assistance given to new immigrants for their first rent payments.

The information came from a statement from the Knesset Committee on Immigration, Absorption and Diaspora Affairs, led by Oded Forer, of the opposition Yisrael Beytenu party.

The official document revealed that, starting with the immigrants who arrived in Israel last March, the assistance figure will be NIS 363 per month, which is equivalent to $97.

The period will be two years, which translates into a total assistance of $2.340. Until now, the total assistance was $4.430, delivered monthly over a five-year period.

New immigrants will receive additional assistance only if they settle in the so-called national priority areas, which include, for example, communities located on the border with the Gaza Strip. Immigrants who relocate to these areas will receive up to an extra $400 per month, depending on family composition.

Forer was against the measure at the last committee meeting, explaining that it was a very harsh message for immigrants and clarifying that they had asked “the ministry to show us the emerging reform in the committee before it was made.” public, but it did not happen.”
